title: 112_s1714
content: The "Dairy Producer Income Protection Act of 2011" may also be known as the Milk Income Loss Contract Program. The Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 is amended to make changes to payment rate adjustments for fiscal years 2012 onwards. The Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 is amended to adjust payment rates for fiscal years 2012-2015 based on the Consumer Price Index. Starting in fiscal year 2016, this adjustment authority will end. Starting in fiscal year 2016, this adjustment authority will end. Amendments include changes to milk price support authority and dates for certain provisions. The text chunk discusses the repeal of various dairy programs, including the dairy product price support program and the dairy export incentive program. Amendments are made to sections of different acts to reflect these changes. Amendments are made to sections of different acts to reflect these changes, specifically by redesignating subparagraphs within the legislation. Federal milk marketing reform is discussed in Section 3. The Secretary of Agriculture will conduct hearings within 180 days to assess transitioning Federal milk marketing orders to a competitive pay pricing system. The hearings will analyze proposed reforms and explore improving price discovery for dairy producers. The Secretary of Agriculture will use risk management tools to assess the transparency of a 2-class competitive pay pricing system for milk products and analyze the impact of eliminating a minimum regulated price on price volatility in dairy markets. The budgetary effects of this Act will be determined by reference to the latest statement submitted by the Chairman of the Senate Budget Committee prior to the vote on passage.
